title: Cup And Saucer, "Floral Decoration", 1925–30
markings: Marks: Cup (underside): faint traces of hammer, sickle, cog stamped in blue under-glaze. Saucer (underside): hammer, sickle, cog stamped in green underglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Cup with swelling shape, loop handle; saucer round, slightly raised towardsedges. Cup painted with polychrome loose stylized floral and leaf pattern around sides, thin gilded bands upper and lower edges. Saucer painted withsame pattern, bordered by thin gilded bands; center unpainted.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup And Saucer, "Floral Decoration", 1925–30.
1925–30. Porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-77-a,b.
